revised_title: Investigations on the Sterilization of Organic Infusions and the Role of Atmospheric Air in Spontaneous Generation
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the effectiveness of sterilization methods on organic infusions and the role of atmospheric air in spontaneous generation. They found that five minutes of boiling was sufficient to sterilize various types of infusions, and that atmospheric air played a crucial role in the development of life in organic infusions. The author's findings challenged previous theories and contributed to the understanding of microbiology and sterilization techniques.
